content: So much of the myths of success revolve around the one trick or overnight hit. It makes for a cool story, sure, but it doesn’t represent reality for most people. Like you say here, the reality of what it takes to turn pro is tenacity, failure, and commitment to getting up and doing it again — win, lose, or draw. If you can’t find a way to enjoy and/or stick to the climb, you won’t find a way to see the view from the summit.
